column4: Apple asks court to make Samsung pay $180 mln more in patent dispute
column5: NEW YORK Just over a week after Samsung paid Apple more than $548 million for infringing the patents and designs of the iPhone  Apple has asked a U.S. court to force its biggest smartphone rival to cough up even more.

column4: Bridgestone raises offer for Pep Boys  trumps Icahn
column5: Japanese tire maker Bridgestone Corp  raised its offer for Pep Boys-Manny  Moe & Jack  to about $947 million  trumping activist investor Carl Icahn's current $900 million bid.

column4: UPDATE 2-Bridgestone raises offer for Pep Boys to $947 mln
column5: Dec 24 Japanese tire maker Bridgestone Corp  raised its offer to buy U.S. auto parts maker Pep Boys-Manny Moe & Jack to $947 million  still below a possible sweetened offer by activist investor Carl Icahn.

column4: INSIGHT-In an M&A boom year  deals-driven hedge funds are burned by bad bets
column5: NEW YORK  Dec 24 This year  betting on corporate takeovers and restructurings should have been a sure thing for investors as the value of deals soared to record levels. It didn't work out that way.

column4: Chipotle's latest E. coli cases may remain unsolved mystery
column5: CHICAGO Chipotle Mexican Grill said on Thursday it may never pinpoint what caused an E. coli outbreak last month linked to two restaurants in Kansas and Oklahoma  extending a mystery over dozens of illnesses tied to the burrito chain.

column4: Hyatt Hotels attacked with payment-card stealing malware
column5: Hyatt Hotels Corp said on Wednesday that its payment processing system was infected with credit-card-stealing malware in an attack discovered three weeks ago  the latest in a series of breaches at hospitality firms.

column4: Russia's Mechel  Polyus  Alrosa may get $444 mln from state budget - Interfax
column5: MOSCOW  Dec 24 Russia's coal and steel producer Mechel  gold miner Polyus Gold and state-controlled diamond producer Alrosa may receive 31 billion roubles ($444 million) of Russian budget funds  Interfax news agency reported on Thursday.

column4: OpenText taps former Oracle hand as its new president
column5: TORONTO OpenText Corp said on Thursday it has tapped former Oracle Corp executive Stephen Murphy as its new president  giving Chief Executive Officer Mark Barrenechea more time to focus on strategy and the company's product road map.

column4: Japan's SMFG says eyeing fintech investments ahead of regulation change
column5: TOKYO  Dec 25 Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group  is seeking to buy into the rapidly growing financial technology sector ahead of the lifting of a ban on such investments next year  the president of Japan's third-largest bank said.

column4: U.S. retailers at risk of missing modest holiday sales goals
